com.vais.controllers

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vais.controllers.UserController

  • @Controller
 @Transactional
 @SessionAttributes(value={"userId","role"})
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    this controller reacts to FE requests and manipulate with user entities in database via hibernate
    Author:
    Eduard

    • Method Detail

      • logIn

        @RequestMapping(value="/login",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String logIn(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                                                                             @RequestParam
                                                                                             java.lang.String login,
                                                                                             @RequestParam
                                                                                             java.lang.String passw)
        check if user with such parameters exists in database. After that puts user's data into session and redirects request to appropriate page.
        Parameters:
        model - Spring ModelMap class used to put parameters into session
        login - received from request
        passw - user's password received from request
        Returns:
        redirection page

      • registration

        @RequestMapping(value="/registration",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String registration(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                                                                                           @RequestParam(required=false)
                                                                                                           java.lang.String login,
                                                                                                           @RequestParam(required=false)
                                                                                                           java.lang.String password1,
                                                                                                           @RequestParam
                                                                                                           java.lang.String email)
        adds new user with such as incoming parameters into the database, but only in case if user doesn't already exist.
        Parameters:
        model - Spring ModelMap class used to put and get parameters from session
        login - received from request
        password1 - user's password received from request
        email - user's email received from request
        Returns:
        redirection to appropriate page

      • getUsers

        @RequestMapping(value="/users",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.ui.Model getUsers(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                                           org.springframework.ui.ModelMap modelMap)
        reponses to request by retrieving from database and putting user entities into response
        Parameters:
        model - used to put data into response
        modelMap - Spring ModelMap class used to put and get parameters from session
        Returns:
        Spring model class with data

      • changeStatus

        @RequestMapping(value="/users/{userId}")
public java.lang.String changeStatus(@PathVariable
                                                                               java.lang.Long userId,
                                                                               @RequestParam(required=false)
                                                                               java.lang.String setStatus,
                                                                               @RequestParam
                                                                               java.lang.String command)
        process request for updating or deleting an entity from the database. Extracts parameters from request such as type of command to be applied and status if there is some.
        Parameters:
        userId - identifier of entity to work with
        setStatus - status of the entity
        command - type of command that has to be applied
        Returns:
        appropriate redirect link

      • addUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/users",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String addUser(@RequestParam
                                                                                               java.lang.String login,
                                                                                               @RequestParam(required=true)
                                                                                               java.lang.String email,
                                                                                               @RequestParam(required=true)
                                                                                               java.lang.String password1,
                                                                                               @RequestParam
                                                                                               java.lang.String setRole,
                                                                                               org.springframework.ui.ModelMap modelMap)
        process request for adding new entity to the database. Extracts all required parameters from request.
        Parameters:
        login - user's name
        email - user's email
        password1 - user's password
        setRole - user's role
        modelMap - spring ModelMap class used to extract data from the session
        Returns:
        appropriate redirect link
